member.name: T:KudyStudio.Utility.OsDetector.CpuUsageNt
member.summary: Inherits the CPUUsage class and implements the Query method for Windows NT systems.

remarks.p: This class works on Windows NT4, Windows 2000, Windows XP, Windows .NET Server and higher.
You should not use this class directly in your code. Use the CPUUsage.Create() method to instantiate a CPUUsage object.

member.summary: NtQuerySystemInformation is an internal Windows function that retrieves various kinds of system information.
member.param: One of the values enumerated in SYSTEM_INFORMATION_CLASS, indicating the kind of system information to be retrieved.

Optional pointer to a location where the function writes the actual size of the information requested.
member.returns: Returns a success NTSTATUS if successful, and an NTSTATUS error code otherwise.

member.name: T:KudyStudio.Data.OleDbHelper
member.summary: The OleDbHelper class is intended to encapsulate high performance, scalable best practices for common uses of OleDb.

member.name: M:KudyStudio.Data.OleDbHelper.AttachParameters(System.Data.OleDb.OleDbCommand,System.Data.OleDb.OleDbParameter[])
member.summary:
This method is used to attach array of SqlParameters to a SqlCommand.
This method will assign a value of DbNull to any parameter with a direction of InputOutput and a value of null.
This behavior will prevent default values from being used, but this will be the less common case than an intended pure output parameter (derived as InputOutput) where the user provided no input value.
member.param: The command to which the parameters will be added
an array of SqlParameters tho be added to command

member.name: M:KudyStudio.Data.OleDbHelper.AssignParameterValues(System.Data.OleDb.OleDbParameter[],System.Object[])
member.summary: This method assigns an array of values to an array of SqlParameters.
member.param: array of SqlParameters to be assigned values
array of objects holding the values to be assigned

member.name: M:KudyStudio.Data.OleDbHelper.PrepareCommand(System.Data.OleDb.OleDbCommand,System.Data.OleDb.OleDbConnection,System.Data.OleDb.OleDbTransaction,System.Data.CommandType,System.String,System.Data.OleDb.OleDbParameter[])
member.summary: This method opens (if necessary) and assigns a connection, transaction, command type and parameters to the provided command.
member.param: the SqlCommand to be prepared
a valid SqlConnection, on which to execute this command
a valid SqlTransaction, or 'null'
the CommandType (stored procedure, text, etc.)
the stored procedure name or T-SQL command
an array of SqlParameters to be associated with the command or 'null' if no parameters are required

member.name: M:KudyStudio.Data.OleDbHelper.ExecuteNonQuery(System.String,System.Data.CommandType,System.String)
member.summary: Execute a OleDbCommand (that returns no resultset and takes no parameters) against the database specified in the connection string.
member.remarks: e.g.: int result = ExecuteNonQuery(connString, CommandType.StoredProcedure, "PublishOrders");
member.param: a valid connection string for a SqlConnection
the CommandType (stored procedure, text, etc.)
the stored procedure name or T-SQL command
member.returns: an int representing the number of rows affected by the command

member.name: M:KudyStudio.Data.OleDbHelper.ExecuteNonQuery(System.String,System.Data.CommandType,System.String,System.Data.OleDb.OleDbParameter[])
member.summary: Execute a OleDbCommand (that returns no resultset) against the database specified in the connection string using the provided parameters.
member.remarks: e.g.: int result = ExecuteNonQuery(connString, CommandType.StoredProcedure, "PublishOrders", new OleDbParameter("@prodid", 24));
member.param: a valid connection string for a SqlConnection
the CommandType (stored procedure, text, etc.)
the stored procedure name or T-SQL command
an array of SqlParamters used to execute the command
member.returns: an int representing the number of rows affected by the command

member.name: M:KudyStudio.Data.OleDbHelper.ExecuteNonQuery(System.String,System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary: Execute a stored procedure via a OleDbCommand (that returns no resultset) against the database specified in the connection string using the provided parameter values. This method will query the database to discover the parameters for the stored procedure (the first time each stored procedure is called), and assign the values based on parameter order.
member.param: a valid connection string for a SqlConnection
the name of the stored prcedure
an array of objects to be assigned as the input values of the stored procedure
member.returns: an int representing the number of rows affected by the command

member.name: M:KudyStudio.Caching.Memcached.MemcachedClient.Increment(System.String,System.UInt32)
member.summary: Increments the value of the specified key by the given amount. The operation is atomic and happens on the server.
member.param: The identifier for the item to increment.
The value by which the client wants to increase the item.
member.returns: The new value of the item or -1 if not found.
member.remarks: The item must be inserted into the cache before it can be changed. The item must be inserted as a . The operation only works with values, so -1 always indicates that the item was not found.

member.name: M:KudyStudio.Caching.Memcached.MemcachedClient.Decrement(System.String,System.UInt32)
member.summary: Increments the value of the specified key by the given amount. The operation is atomic and happens on the server.
member.param: The identifier for the item to increment.
The value by which the client wants to decrease the item.
member.returns: The new value of the item or -1 if not found.
member.remarks: The item must be inserted into the cache before it can be changed. The item must be inserted as a . The operation only works with values, so -1 always indicates that the item was not found.

member.name: M:KudyStudio.Caching.Memcached.MemcachedClient.FlushAll
member.summary: Send the flush command to all servers, thereby deleting all items on all servers.
Returns true only if succeeds in clearing all servers.
member.returns: true only if succeeds in clearing all servers, otherwise false.

member.name: M:KudyStudio.Caching.Memcached.MemcachedClient.FlushAll(System.TimeSpan,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Send the flush command to all servers, thereby deleting all items on all servers using delay.
member.param: The delay for flush action.

If set staggered true, the client will increase the delay for each server, i.e. the first will flush after delay*0, the second after delay*1, the third after delay*2, etc. If set to false, all servers will flush after the same delay.
member.returns: true only if succeeds in clearing all servers, otherwise false.

member.name: M:KudyStudio.Caching.Memcached.MemcachedClient.FlushAll(System.String[])
member.summary: Send the flush command to all servers, thereby deleting all items on the specified servers.
member.param: The servers to flush or set it null to flush all servers.
member.returns: true only if succeeds in clearing all servers, otherwise false.

member.name: M:KudyStudio.Caching.Memcached.MemcachedClient.FlushAll(System.String[],System.TimeSpan,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Send the flush command to all servers, thereby deleting all items on the specified servers using delay.
member.param: The servers to flush or set it null to flush all servers.
The delay for flush action.

If set staggered true, the client will increase the delay for each server, i.e. the first will flush after delay*0, the second after delay*1, the third after delay*2, etc. If set to false, all servers will flush after the same delay.
member.returns: true only if succeeds in clearing all servers, otherwise false.

member.name: T:KudyStudio.Utility.TaskScheduler.TaskFlags
member.summary: Options for a task, used for the Flags property of a Task. Uses the "Flags" attribute, so these values are combined with |. Some flags are documented as Windows 95 only, but they have a user interface in Windows XP so that may not be true.

member.name: F:KudyStudio.Utility.TaskScheduler.TaskFlags.Interactive
member.summary: The precise meaning of this flag is elusive. The MSDN documentation describes it only for use in converting jobs from the Windows NT "AT" service to the newer Task Scheduler. No other use for the flag is documented.

member.name: F:KudyStudio.Utility.TaskScheduler.TaskFlags.DeleteWhenDone
member.summary: The task will be deleted when there are no more scheduled run times.

member.name: F:KudyStudio.Utility.TaskScheduler.TaskFlags.Disabled
member.summary: The task is disabled. Used to temporarily prevent a task from being triggered normally.

member.name: F:KudyStudio.Utility.TaskScheduler.TaskFlags.StartOnlyIfIdle
member.summary: The task begins only if the computer is idle at the scheduled start time. The computer is not considered idle until the task's time elapses with no user input.

member.name: F:KudyStudio.Utility.TaskScheduler.TaskFlags.KillOnIdleEnd
member.summary: The task terminates if the computer makes an idle to non-idle transition while the task is running. For information regarding idle triggers, see .

member.name: F:KudyStudio.Utility.TaskScheduler.TaskFlags.DontStartIfOnBatteries
member.summary: The task does not start if the computer is running on battery power.

member.name: F:KudyStudio.Utility.TaskScheduler.TaskFlags.KillIfGoingOnBatteries
member.summary: The task ends, and the associated application quits if the computer switches to battery power.

member.name: F:KudyStudio.Utility.TaskScheduler.TaskFlags.RunOnlyIfDocked
member.summary: The task runs only if the system is docked. (Not mentioned in current MSDN documentation; probably obsolete.)

member.name: F:KudyStudio.Utility.TaskScheduler.TaskFlags.Hidden
member.summary:
The task item is hidden.
This is implemented by setting the job file's hidden attribute. Testing revealed that clearing this flag doesn't clear the file attribute, so the library sets the file attribute directly. This flag is kept in sync with the task's Hidden property, so they function equivalently.

member.name: F:KudyStudio.Utility.TaskScheduler.TaskFlags.RunIfConnectedToInternet
member.summary: The task runs only if there is currently a valid Internet connection. Not currently implemented. (Check current MSDN documentation for updates.)

member.name: F:KudyStudio.Utility.TaskScheduler.TaskFlags.RestartOnIdleResume
member.summary: The task starts again if the computer makes a non-idle to idle transition before all the task's task_triggers elapse. (Use this flag in conjunction with KillOnIdleEnd.)

member.name: F:KudyStudio.Utility.TaskScheduler.TaskFlags.SystemRequired
member.summary: Wake the computer to run this task. Seems to be misnamed, but the name is taken from the low-level interface.

member.name: F:KudyStudio.Utility.TaskScheduler.TaskFlags.RunOnlyIfLoggedOn
member.summary: The task runs only if the user specified in SetAccountInformation() is logged on interactively. This flag has no effect on tasks set to run in the local SYSTEM account.

member.name: M:KudyStudio.Data.SqlServerHelper.AttachParameters(System.Data.SqlClient.SqlCommand,System.Data.SqlClient.SqlParameter[])
member.summary:
This method is used to attach array of SqlParameters to a SqlCommand.
This method will assign a value of DbNull to any parameter with a direction of InputOutput and a value of null.
This behavior will prevent default values from being used, but this will be the less common case than an intended pure output parameter (derived as InputOutput) where the user provided no input value.
member.param: The command to which the parameters will be added
An array of SqlParameters to be added to command

member.name: M:KudyStudio.Data.SqlServerHelper.ExecuteReader(System.Data.SqlClient.SqlConnection,KudyStudio.Data.SqlServerHelper.SqlConnectionOwnership,System.Data.SqlClient.SqlTransaction,System.Data.CommandType,System.String,System.Data.SqlClient.SqlParameter[])
member.summary: Create and prepare a SqlCommand, and call ExecuteReader with the appropriate CommandBehavior.
member.remarks:
If we created and opened the connection, we want the connection to be closed when the DataReader is closed.
If the caller provided the connection, we want to leave it to them to manage.
member.param: A valid SqlConnection, on which to execute this command.
Indicates whether the connection parameter was provided by the caller, or created by SqlServerHelper.
A valid SqlTransaction, or 'null'.
The CommandType (stored procedure, text, etc.).
The stored procedure name or T-SQL command.
An array of SqlParameters to be associated with the command or 'null' if no parameters are required.
member.returns: DataReader containing the results of the command.

member.summary: Execute a stored procedure via a SqlCommand (that returns a resultset) against the specified SqlConnection using the provided parameter values. This method will query the database to discover the parameters for the stored procedure (the first time each stored procedure is called), and assign the values based on parameter order.
member.remarks: This method provides no access to output parameters or the stored procedure's return value parameter.
member.param: A valid SqlConnection.
The name of the stored procedure using "FOR XML AUTO".
An array of objects to be assigned as the input values of the stored procedure.
member.returns: An XmlReader containing the resultset generated by the command.

member.remarks: e.g.: FillDataset(connString, CommandType.StoredProcedure, "GetOrders", ds, new string[] {"orders"});
member.param: A valid connection string for a SqlConnection
The CommandType (stored procedure, text, etc.)
The stored procedure name or T-SQL command
A dataset wich will contain the resultset generated by the command
This array will be used to create table mappings allowing the DataTables to be referenced by a user defined name (probably the actual table name)

member.returns: An int representing the number of rows affected by the command.

member.name: M:KudyStudio.Utility.Threading.IWorkItemResult`1.Cancel(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Cancel the work item execution. If the work item is in the queue then it won't execute If the work item is completed, it will remain completed If the work item is in progress then the user can check the SmartThreadPool.IsWorkItemCanceled property to check if the work item has been cancelled. If the abortExecution is set to true then the Smart Thread Pool will send an AbortException to the running thread to stop the execution of the work item. When an in progress work item is canceled its GetResult will throw WorkItemCancelException. If the work item is already cancelled it will remain cancelled
member.param: When true send an AbortException to the executing thread.
member.returns: Returns true if the work item was not completed, otherwise false.

member.name: T:KudyStudio.Utility.TaskScheduler.StartableTrigger
member.summary: Generalization of all triggers that have a start time.
member.remarks: StartableTrigger serves as a base class for triggers with a start time, but it has little use to clients.

member.name: T:KudyStudio.Utility.TaskScheduler.Trigger
member.summary: Trigger is a generalization of all the concrete trigger classes, and any actual Trigger object is one of those types. When included in the TriggerList of a Task, a Trigger determines when a scheduled task will be run.

remarks.para: Create a concrete trigger for a specific start condition and then call TriggerList.Add to include it in a task's TriggerList.

A Trigger that is not yet in a Task's TriggerList is said to be unbound and it holds no resources (i.e. COM interfaces). Once it is added to a TriggerList, it is bound and holds a COM interface that is only released when the Trigger is removed from the list or the corresponding Task is closed.

A Trigger that is already bound cannot be added to a TriggerList. To copy a Trigger from one list to another, use to create an unbound copy and then add the copy to the new list. To move a Trigger from one list to another, use to extract the Trigger from the first list before adding it to the second.

member.summary: Internal base constructor for an unbound Trigger.

member.summary: Bind a Trigger object to an ITaskTrigger interface. This causes the Trigger to sync itself with the interface and remain in sync whenever it is modified in the future. If the Trigger is already bound, an ArgumentException is thrown.

member.exception: Attempt to bind and already bound trigger.

member.summary: Gets or sets indication that the task uses an EndDate. Returns true if a value has been set for the EndDate property. Set can only be used to turn indication off.
member.exception: Has EndDate becomes true only by setting the EndDate property.

member.name: P:KudyStudio.Utility.TaskScheduler.Trigger.EndDate
member.summary: Gets or sets the ending year, month, and day for the trigger. After a value has been set with EndDate, HasEndDate becomes true.

member.name: P:KudyStudio.Utility.TaskScheduler.Trigger.DurationMinutes
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of minutes after the trigger fires that it remains active. Used in conjunction with to run a task repeatedly for a period of time. For example, if you want to start a task at 8:00 A.M. repeatedly restart it until 5:00 P.M., there would be 540 minutes (9 hours) in the duration. Can also be used to terminate a task that is running when the DurationMinutes expire. Use to specify that task should be terminated at that time.
member.exception: Setting must be greater than or equal to the IntervalMinutes setting.

member.summary: Copy the input to the output, deleting the characters which are insignificant to CSS. Comments will be removed. Tabs will be replaced with spaces. Carriage returns will be replaced with linefeeds. Most spaces and linefeeds will be removed.

member.name: M:KudyStudio.Web.CssCompressor.CssCompressorImpl.Action(System.Int32)
member.summary:
Do something! What you do is determined by the argument:
1 Output A. Copy B to A. Get the next B.
2 Copy B to A. Get the next B. (Delete A).
3 Get the next B. (Delete B). action treats a string as a single character. Wow! action recognizes a regular expression if it is preceded by ( or , or =.

member.summary: Get the next character without getting it.

member.summary: Return the next character from stdin. Watch out for lookahead. If the character is a control character, translate it to a space or linefeed.

member.returns: Hash value formatted as a base64-encoded string.

member.name: M:KudyStudio.Crypto.ComputeSaltedHash(System.Byte[],System.String)

Name of the hash algorithm. Allowed values are: "MD5", "SHA1", "SHA256", "SHA384", and "SHA512" (if any other value is specified MD5 hashing algorithm will be used). This value is case-insensitive.

member.name: T:KudyStudio.Crypto.DataProtection
member.summary: Encrypts and decrypts data using DPAPI(Data Protection API) functions. This class cannot be inherited.

member.name: F:KudyStudio.Crypto.DataProtection.DefaultStore
member.summary: It is reasonable to set default key type to user key.

member.name: M:KudyStudio.Crypto.DataProtection.EncryptToBase64String(KudyStudio.Crypto.DataProtection.Store,System.String)
member.summary: Calls DPAPI CryptProtectData function to encrypt a plaintext string value. This function does not specify data description and additional entropy.
member.param: Defines type of encryption store to use. When user store is specified, any application running under the same user account as the one making this call, will be able to decrypt data. Machine store will allow any application running on the same computer where data were encrypted to perform decryption. Note: If optional entropy is specifed, it will be required for decryption.
Plaintext data to be encrypted.
member.returns: Encrypted value in a base64-encoded format.

member.name: M:KudyStudio.Crypto.DataProtection.EncryptToBase64String(KudyStudio.Crypto.DataProtection.Store,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Calls DPAPI CryptProtectData function to encrypt a plaintext string value. This function does not specify data description.
member.param: Defines type of encryption store to use. When user store is specified, any application running under the same user account as the one making this call, will be able to decrypt data. Machine store will allow any application running on the same computer where data were encrypted to perform decryption. Note: If optional entropy is specifed, it will be required for decryption.
Plaintext data to be encrypted.
Optional entropy which - if specified - will be required to perform decryption.
member.returns: Encrypted value in a base64-encoded format.

member.name: M:KudyStudio.Crypto.DataProtection.EncryptToBase64String(KudyStudio.Crypto.DataProtection.Store,System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Calls DPAPI CryptProtectData function to encrypt a plaintext string value.
member.param: Defines type of encryption store to use. When user store is specified, any application running under the same user account as the one making this call, will be able to decrypt data. Machine store will allow any application running on the same computer where data were encrypted to perform decryption. Note: If optional entropy is specifed, it will be required for decryption.
Plaintext data to be encrypted.
Optional entropy which - if specified - will be required to perform decryption.
Optional description of data to be encrypted. If this value is specified, it will be stored along with encrypted data and returned as a separate value during decryption.
member.returns: Encrypted value in a base64-encoded format.

member.name: M:KudyStudio.Crypto.DataProtection.Encrypt(KudyStudio.Crypto.DataProtection.Store,System.Byte[],System.Byte[],System.String)
member.summary: Calls DPAPI CryptProtectData function to encrypt an array of plaintext bytes.
member.param: Defines type of encryption store to use. When user store is specified, any application running under the same user account as the one making this call, will be able to decrypt data. Machine store will allow any application running on the same computer where data were encrypted to perform decryption. Note: If optional entropy is specifed, it will be required for decryption.
Plaintext data to be encrypted.
Optional entropy which - if specified - will be required to perform decryption.
Optional description of data to be encrypted. If this value is specified, it will be stored along with encrypted data and returned as a separate value during decryption.
member.returns: Encrypted value.

member.name: M:KudyStudio.Crypto.DataProtection.DecryptFromBase64String(KudyStudio.Crypto.DataProtection.Store,System.String)
member.summary: Calls DPAPI CryptUnprotectData to decrypt ciphertext bytes. This function does not use additional entropy and does not return data description.
member.remarks: When decrypting data, it is not necessary to specify which type of encryption key to use: user-specific or machine-specific; DPAPI will figure it out by looking at the signature of encrypted data.
member.param: Defines type of encryption store to use. When user store is specified, any application running under the same user account as the one making this call, will be able to decrypt data. Machine store will allow any application running on the same computer where data were encrypted to perform decryption. Note: If optional entropy is specifed, it will be required for decryption.
Encrypted data formatted as a base64-encoded string.
member.returns: Decrypted data returned as a UTF-8 string.

member.name: M:KudyStudio.Crypto.DataProtection.DecryptFromBase64String(KudyStudio.Crypto.DataProtection.Store,System.String,System.String@)
member.summary: Calls DPAPI CryptUnprotectData to decrypt ciphertext bytes. This function does not use additional entropy.
member.remarks: When decrypting data, it is not necessary to specify which type of encryption key to use: user-specific or machine-specific; DPAPI will figure it out by looking at the signature of encrypted data.
member.param: Defines type of encryption store to use. When user store is specified, any application running under the same user account as the one making this call, will be able to decrypt data. Machine store will allow any application running on the same computer where data were encrypted to perform decryption. Note: If optional entropy is specifed, it will be required for decryption.
Encrypted data formatted as a base64-encoded string.
Returned description of data specified during encryption.
member.returns: Decrypted data returned as a UTF-8 string.

member.name: M:KudyStudio.Crypto.DataProtection.DecryptFromBase64String(KudyStudio.Crypto.DataProtection.Store,System.String,System.String,System.String@)
member.summary: Calls DPAPI CryptUnprotectData to decrypt ciphertext bytes.
member.remarks: When decrypting data, it is not necessary to specify which type of encryption key to use: user-specific or machine-specific; DPAPI will figure it out by looking at the signature of encrypted data.
member.param: Defines type of encryption store to use. When user store is specified, any application running under the same user account as the one making this call, will be able to decrypt data. Machine store will allow any application running on the same computer where data were encrypted to perform decryption. Note: If optional entropy is specifed, it will be required for decryption.
Encrypted data formatted as a base64-encoded string.
Optional entropy, which is required if it was specified during encryption.
Returned description of data specified during encryption.
member.returns: Decrypted data returned as a UTF-8 string.

Machine store will allow any application running on the same computer where data were encrypted to perform decryption. Note: If optional entropy is specifed, it will be required for decryption.
Encrypted data.
Optional entropy, which is required if it was specified during encryption.

member.name: T:KudyStudio.Crypto.Password
member.summary: This class can generate random passwords, which do not include ambiguous characters, such as I, l, and 1. The generated password will be made of 7-bit ASCII symbols. Every four characters will include one lower case character, one upper case character, one number, and one special symbol (such as '%') in a random order. The password will always start with an alpha-numeric character; it will not start with a special symbol (we do this because some back-end systems do not like certain special characters in the first position).
member.remarks: Generates random password, which complies with the strong password rules and does not contain ambiguous characters.

member.name: M:KudyStudio.Crypto.Password.Generate
member.summary: Generates a random password.
member.returns: Randomly generated password.
member.remarks: The length of the generated password will be determined at random. It will be no shorter than the minimum default and no longer than maximum default.

member.name: M:KudyStudio.Crypto.Password.Generate(System.Int32)
member.summary: Generates a random password of the exact length.
member.param: Exact password length.
member.returns: Randomly generated password.

member.name: M:KudyStudio.Crypto.Password.Generate(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Generates a random password.
member.param: Minimum password length.
Maximum password length.
member.returns: Randomly generated password.
member.remarks: The length of the generated password will be determined at random and it will fall with the range determined by the function parameters.

member.name: M:KudyStudio.Utility.TaskScheduler.Interop.CoTaskMem.LPWStrToString(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Many COM methods in ITask, ITaskTrigger, and ITaskScheduler return an LPWStr which should should be freed after the string is accessed. The "out" pointer could be converted to a string during marshalling, but then the memory wouldn't be freed. Instead these entries return an IntPtr--call this method to convert it to a string.
member.param: A pointer to a unicode string in COM Task Memory, invalid at exit.
member.returns: String value.

member.name: T:KudyStudio.Web.JavascriptCompressor
member.summary: Helper class to minify javascript source file.

member.name: M:KudyStudio.Web.JavascriptCompressor.JavascriptCompressorImpl.Compress
member.summary: Copy the input to the output, deleting the characters which are insignificant to JavaScript. Comments will be removed. Tabs will be replaced with spaces. Carriage returns will be replaced with linefeeds. Most spaces and linefeeds will be removed.

member.name: M:KudyStudio.Web.JavascriptCompressor.JavascriptCompressorImpl.Action(System.Int32)
member.summary:
Do something! What you do is determined by the argument:
1 Output A. Copy B to A. Get the next B.
2 Copy B to A. Get the next B. (Delete A).
3 Get the next B. (Delete B). action treats a string as a single character. Wow! action recognizes a regular expression if it is preceded by ( or , or =.

member.name: M:KudyStudio.Web.JavascriptCompressor.JavascriptCompressorImpl.Next
member.summary: Get the next character, excluding comments. Peek() is used to see if a '/' is followed by a '/' or '*'.

member.name: M:KudyStudio.Web.JavascriptCompressor.JavascriptCompressorImpl.Peek
member.summary: Get the next character without getting it.

member.name: M:KudyStudio.Web.JavascriptCompressor.JavascriptCompressorImpl.Get

member.name: T:KudyStudio.Utility.TaskScheduler.TaskList
member.summary: Deprecated. Provided for V1 compatibility only.

remarks.p: Presents the Scheduled Tasks folder as a Task Collection.

A TaskList is indexed by name rather than position. You can't add, remove, or assign tasks in TaskList. Accessing a Task in the list by indexing, or by enumeration, is equivalent to opening a task by calling the ScheduledTasks Open() method.

p.i: Provided for compatibility with version one of the library. Use of Scheduler and TaskList will normally result in COM memory leaks.

member.name: T:KudyStudio.Utility.TaskScheduler.ScheduledTasks
member.summary: ScheduledTasks represents the a computer's Scheduled Tasks folder. Using a ScheduledTasks object, you can discover the names of the tasks in the folder and you can open a task to work with it. You can also create or delete tasks.
member.remarks: A ScheduledTasks object holds a COM interface that can be released by calling .

member.name: F:KudyStudio.Utility.TaskScheduler.ScheduledTasks.taskScheduler
member.summary: Underlying COM interface.

member.name: M:KudyStudio.Utility.TaskScheduler.ScheduledTasks.#ctor
member.summary: Constructor to use Scheduled Tasks of the local computer.

member.name: M:KudyStudio.Utility.TaskScheduler.ScheduledTasks.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Constructor to use Scheduled tasks of a remote computer identified by a UNC name. The calling process must have administrative privileges on the remote machine. May throw exception if the computer's task scheduler cannot be reached, and may give strange results if the argument is not in UNC format.
member.param: The remote computer's UNC name, e.g. "\\DALLAS".
member.exception: The Task Scheduler could not be accessed.

member.name: M:KudyStudio.Utility.TaskScheduler.ScheduledTasks.GetTaskNames
member.summary: Return the names of all scheduled tasks. The names returned include the file extension ".job"; methods requiring a task name can take the name with or without the extension.
member.returns: The names in a string array.

member.name: M:KudyStudio.Utility.TaskScheduler.ScheduledTasks.CreateTask(System.String)
member.summary: Creates a new task on the system with the given .
member.remarks: Task names follow normal filename character restrictions. The name will be come the name of the file used to store the task (with .job added).
member.param: Name for the new task.
member.returns: Instance of new task.
member.exception: There is an existing task with the given name.

member.name: M:KudyStudio.Utility.TaskScheduler.ScheduledTasks.DeleteTask(System.String)
member.summary: Deletes the task of the given .
member.remarks: If you delete a task that is open, a subsequent save will throw an exception. You can save to a filename, however, to create a new task.
member.param: Name of task to delete.
member.returns: True if the task was deleted, false if the task wasn't found.

member.name: M:KudyStudio.Utility.TaskScheduler.ScheduledTasks.OpenTask(System.String)
member.summary: Opens the task with the given . An open task holds COM interfaces which are released by the Task's Close() method.
member.remarks: If the task does not exist, null is returned.
member.param: Name of task to open.
member.returns: An instance of a Task, or null if the task name couldn't be found.

member.name: M:KudyStudio.Utility.TaskScheduler.ScheduledTasks.Dispose
member.summary: The internal COM interface is released. Further access to the object will throw null reference exceptions.

member.name: T:KudyStudio.Utility.Threading.Internal.EventWaitHandleFactory
member.summary: EventWaitHandleFactory class. This is a static class that creates AutoResetEvent and ManualResetEvent objects. In WindowCE the WaitForMultipleObjects API fails to use the Handle property of XxxResetEvent. It can use only handles that were created by the CreateEvent API. Consequently this class creates the needed XxxResetEvent and replaces the handle if it's a WindowsCE OS.

summary.para: Implements a very fast object factory for dynamic object creation. Dynamically generates a factory class whihc will use the new() constructor of the requested type.
Much faster than using Activator at the price of the first invocation being significantly slower than subsequent calls.

member.name: M:KudyStudio.Utility.WebServiceClient.Invoke(System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary: Invokes the method or constructor represented by the current instance, using the specified parameters.
member.param: An argument list for the invoked method or constructor. This is an array of objects with the same number, order, and type as the parameters of the method or constructor to be invoked. If there are no parameters, parameters should be null. If the method or constructor represented by this instance takes a ref parameter (ByRef in Visual Basic), no special attribute is required for that parameter in order to invoke the method or constructor using this function. Any object in this array that is not explicitly initialized with a value will contain the default value for that object type. For reference-type elements, this value is null. For value-type elements, this value is 0, 0.0, or false, depending on the specific element type.
member.returns: An object containing the return value of the invoked method, or null in the case of a constructor.
member.exception: The method does not exist.

member.name: M:KudyStudio.Utility.WebServiceClient.Invoke(System.Reflection.MethodInfo,System.Object[])

member.name: M:KudyStudio.Utility.TaskScheduler.MonthlyTrigger.MaskToIndices(System.Int32)
member.summary: Convert an integer representing a mask to an array where each element contains the index of a bit that is ON in the mask. Bits are considered to number from 1 to 32.
member.param: An interger to be interpreted as a mask.
member.returns: An array with an element for each bit of the mask which is ON.

member.name: M:KudyStudio.Utility.TaskScheduler.MonthlyTrigger.IndicesToMask(System.Int32[])
member.summary: Converts an array of bit indices into a mask with bits turned ON at every index contained in the array. Indices must be from 1 to 32 and bits are numbered the same.
member.param: An array with an element for each bit of the mask which is ON.
member.returns: An interger to be interpreted as a mask.

member.name: P:KudyStudio.Utility.TaskScheduler.MonthlyTrigger.Days

member.name: M:KudyStudio.Utility.TaskScheduler.Task.Run
member.summary: Schedules the task for immediate execution. The system works from the saved version of the task, so call before running. If the task has never been saved, it throws an argument exception. Problems starting the task are reported by the property, not by exceptions on Run.
member.remarks: The system never updates an open task, so you don't get current results for the or the properties until you close and reopen the task.

member.summary: Saves changes to the established task name.
member.overloads: Saves changes that have been made to this Task.
member.remarks: The account name is checked for validity when a Task is saved. The password is not checked, but the account name must be valid (or empty).
member.exception: Unable to establish existence of the account specified.

member.name: M:KudyStudio.Utility.TaskScheduler.Task.Save(System.String)
member.summary: Saves the Task with a new name. The task with the old name continues to exist in whatever state it was last saved. It is no longer open, because. the Task object is associated with the new name from now on. If there is already a task using the new name, it is overwritten.
member.remarks: See the () overload.
member.param: The new name to be used for this task.
member.exception: Unable to establish existence of the account specified.

member.name: M:KudyStudio.Utility.TaskScheduler.Task.Close

member.summary: For compatibility with earlier versions. New clients should use .
member.remarks: Display the property pages of this task for user editing. If the user clicks OK, the task's properties are updated and the task is also automatically saved.

member.name: M:KudyStudio.Utility.TaskScheduler.Task.DisplayPropertySheet
member.summary: Display all property pages.
member.remarks: The method does not return until the user has dismissed the dialog box. If the dialog box is dismissed with the OK button, returns true and updates properties in the task. The changes are not made permanent, however, until the task is saved. (Save() method.)
member.returns: true if dialog box was dismissed with OK, otherwise false.
member.overloads: Display the property pages of this task for user editing.

member.name: M:KudyStudio.Utility.TaskScheduler.Task.SetAccountInformation(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Sets the account under which the task will run. Supply the account name and password as parameters. For the localsystem account, pass an empty string for the account name and null for the password. See Remarks.
member.param: Full account name.
Password for the account.

remarks.p: To have the task to run under the local system account, pass the empty string ("") as accountName and null as the password. The caller must be running in an administrator account or in the local system account.

You can also specify a null password if the task has the flag RunOnlyIfLoggedOn set. This allows you to schedule a task for an account for which you don't know the password, but the account must be logged on interactively at the time the task runs.

member.name: M:KudyStudio.Utility.TaskScheduler.Task.SetAccountInformation(System.String,System.Security.SecureString)
member.summary: Overload for SetAccountInformation which permits use of a SecureString for the password parameter. The decoded password will remain in memory only as long as needed to be passed to the TaskScheduler service.
member.param: Full account name.
Password for the account.

member.name: M:KudyStudio.Utility.TaskScheduler.Task.Terminate
member.summary: Request that the task be terminated if it is currently running. The call returns immediately, although the task may continue briefly. For Windows programs, a WM_CLOSE message is sent first and the task is given three minutes to shut down voluntarily. Should it not, or if the task is not a Windows program, TerminateProcess is used.
member.exception: The task is not running.

member.summary: Gets or sets the associated with the current task.

member.name: P:KudyStudio.Utility.TaskScheduler.Task.IdleWaitMinutes
member.summary: Gets or sets how long the system must remain idle, even after the trigger would normally fire, before the task will run.

member.name: P:KudyStudio.Utility.TaskScheduler.Task.IdleWaitDeadlineMinutes
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum number of minutes that Task Scheduler will wait for a required idle period to occur.

summary.p: Gets or sets the maximum length of time the task is permitted to run. Setting MaxRunTime also affects the value of .
The longest MaxRunTime implemented is 0xFFFFFFFE milliseconds, or about 50 days. If you set a TimeSpan longer than that, the MaxRunTime will be unlimited.
If the maximum run time is limited, the task will be terminated after expires. Setting the value to FALSE, i.e. unlimited, invalidates MaxRunTime.

The Task Scheduler service will try to send a WM_CLOSE message when it needs to terminate a task. If the message can't be sent, or the task does not respond with three minutes, the task will be terminated using TerminateProcess.

member.name: P:KudyStudio.Utility.TaskScheduler.Task.MostRecentRunTime

member.name: P:KudyStudio.Utility.TaskScheduler.Task.NextRunTime
member.summary: Gets the next time the task will run. Returns if the task is not scheduled to run.

member.name: T:KudyStudio.Utility.TaskScheduler.TriggerList
member.summary: TriggerList is a collection of Triggers. Every Task has a TriggerList that is created and destroyed automatically along with the Task. There are no public constructors.

remarks.para: A TriggerList can be empty, and indeed a newly created Task has an empty list. It's not clear how the system handles a task with no triggers, however.

TriggerList implements IList and behaves like other indexable collections with one limitation: You can't insert a Trigger at a position. Insert() throws NotImplementedException. This restriction is based on the underlying API.

member.name: M:KudyStudio.Utility.TaskScheduler.TriggerList.#ctor(KudyStudio.Utility.TaskScheduler.Interop.ITask)
member.summary: Internal constructor creates TriggerList using an ITask interface to initialize.

member.param: Index of trigger to remove.
member.exception: Index out of range.

member.summary: Not implemented; throws NotImplementedException. If implemented, would insert a trigger at a specified index.
member.param: Index to insert trigger.
Value of trigger to insert.

member.exception: Trigger being added is already bound.

member.name: M:KudyStudio.Utility.TaskScheduler.TriggerList.CopyTo(System.Array,System.Int32)
member.summary: Copies all the Triggers in the collection to an array, beginning at the given index. The Triggers assigned to the array are cloned from the originals, implying they are unbound copies. (Can't tell if cloning is the intended semantics for this ICollection method, but it seems a good choice for TriggerLists.)
member.param: Array to copy triggers into.
Index at which to start copying.

member.summary: Unbinds and Disposes all the Triggers in the collection, releasing the com interfaces they hold. Destroys the internal private pointer to the ITask com interface, but does not specifically release the interface because it is also in the containing task.

member.summary: Gets a fully qualified local file path form a path.

member.returns: The fully qualified path.

remarks.para: Converts the path specified to a fully qualified path. If the path is relative it is taken as relative from the application base directory.
The path specified must be a local file path, a URI is not supported.

member.name: P:KudyStudio.EnvironmentUtil.BaseDirectory
member.summary: Gets the base directory for current .
member.value: The base directory path for the current .

member.name: P:KudyStudio.EnvironmentUtil.ConfigurationFile
member.summary: Gets the path to the configuration file for the current .
member.value: The path to the configuration file for the current .

remarks.para: The .NET Compact Framework 1.0 does not have a concept of a configuration file. For this runtime, we use the entry assembly location as the root for the configuration file name.
The value returned may be either a local file path or a URI.

member.name: P:KudyStudio.EnvironmentUtil.EntryAssemblyLocation
member.summary: Gets the path to the file that first executed in the current .
member.value: The path to the entry assembly.

remarks.para: Gets the path to the file that first executed in the current .

member.name: P:KudyStudio.EnvironmentUtil.CurrentThreadId
member.summary: Gets the ID of the current thread.
member.value: The ID of the current thread.

remarks.para: On the .NET framework, the AppDomain.GetCurrentThreadId method is used to obtain the thread ID for the current thread. This is the operating system ID for the thread.

On the .NET Compact Framework 1.0 it is not possible to get the operating system thread ID for the current thread. The native method GetCurrentThreadId is implemented inline in a header file and cannot be called.

member.name: P:KudyStudio.EnvironmentUtil.HostName
member.summary: Get the host name or machine name for the current machine

remarks.para: Get the host name or machine name for the current machine
The host name () or the machine name (Environment.MachineName) for the current machine, or if neither of these are available then NOT AVAILABLE is returned.

member.name: P:KudyStudio.EnvironmentUtil.FriendlyName
member.summary: Get this application's friendly name
member.value: The friendly name of this application as a string

remarks.para: If available the name of the application is retrieved from the AppDomain using AppDomain.CurrentDomain.FriendlyName.
Otherwise the file name of the entry assembly is used.

member.name: P:KudyStudio.EnvironmentUtil.ProcessStartTime
member.summary: Get the start time for the current process.

remarks.para: Tries to get the start time for the current process. Failing that it returns the time of the first call to this property.
Note that AppDomains may be loaded and unloaded within the same process without the process terminating and therefore without the process start time being reset.

member.summary: The KudyStudio assembly.

member.name: M:KudyStudio.AssemblyUtil.GetAssemblyLocation(System.Reflection.Assembly)
member.summary: Gets the assembly location path for the specified assembly.
member.param: The assembly to get the location for.
member.returns: The location of the assembly.
member.remarks: This method does not guarantee to return the correct path to the assembly. If only tries to give an indication as to where the assembly was loaded from.

member.name: M:KudyStudio.AssemblyUtil.GetAssemblyShortName(System.Reflection.Assembly)
member.summary: Gets the short name of the .
member.param: The to get the name for.
member.returns: The short name of the .

remarks.para: The short name of the assembly is the without the version, culture, or public key. i.e. it is just the assembly's file name without the extension.
Use this rather than Assembly.GetName().Name because that is not available on the Compact Framework.
Because of a FileIOPermission security demand we cannot do the obvious Assembly.GetName().Name. We are allowed to get the of the assembly so we start from there and strip out just the assembly name.

member.name: M:KudyStudio.AssemblyUtil.GetAssemblyFileName(System.Reflection.Assembly)
member.summary: Gets the file name portion of the , including the extension.
member.param: The to get the file name for.
member.returns: The file name of the assembly.

member.name: M:KudyStudio.AssemblyUtil.GetTypeFromString(System.String,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Loads the type specified in the type string.
member.param: The name of the type to load.
Flag set to true to throw an exception if the type cannot be loaded.
true to ignore the case of the type name; otherwise, false
member.returns: The type loaded or null if it could not be loaded.

remarks.para: If the type name is fully qualified, i.e. if contains an assembly name in the type name, the type will be loaded from the system using .

If the type name is not fully qualified it will be loaded from the assembly that is directly calling this method. If the type is not found in the assembly then all the loaded assemblies will be searched for the type.

member.name: M:KudyStudio.AssemblyUtil.GetTypeFromString(System.Type,System.String,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Loads the type specified in the type string.
member.param: A sibling type to use to load the type.
The name of the type to load.
Flag set to true to throw an exception if the type cannot be loaded.
true to ignore the case of the type name; otherwise, false
member.returns: The type loaded or null if it could not be loaded.

remarks.para: If the type name is fully qualified, i.e. if contains an assembly name in the type name, the type will be loaded from the system using .

If the type name is not fully qualified, it will be loaded from the assembly containing the specified relative type. If the type is not found in the assembly then all the loaded assemblies will be searched for the type.

member.name: M:KudyStudio.AssemblyUtil.GetTypeFromString(System.Reflection.Assembly,System.String,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)

remarks.para: If the type name is fully qualified, i.e. if contains an assembly name in the type name, the type will be loaded from the system using .
If the type name is not fully qualified it will be loaded from the specified assembly. If the type is not found in the assembly then all the loaded assemblies will be searched for the type.
